[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Hotel Management System (HMS) defines requirements for managing hotel rooms, reservations, pricing, and tenant records.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: HMS supports room management, reservation processing, pricing control, and customer accommodation tracking.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: HMS integrates with hotel databases, payment systems, and booking platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: HMS provides dashboards for hotel managers to handle reservations and pricing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: HMS supports check-in kiosks and mobile booking devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: HMS uses relational databases and REST APIs for booking and payment transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: HMS secures transactions through encryption and authentication mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Optimized for storing room availability, tenant records, and pricing information.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: HMS manages room rentals, tenant records, reservations, and payment verification.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Configurable for hotels of different sizes and policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: HMS connects with booking platforms, payment gateways, and regulatory databases.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: HMS handles room reservations, pricing, customer check-ins, and payment processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for hotel managers, receptionists, and customers booking rooms.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Requires network connectivity for reservations and payment processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Depends on real-time room availability, payment processing, and customer information accuracy.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Tenant: Customer renting a hotel room.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with hotel databases for room details, pricing, and availability (REQ-DB-70).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall manage customer reservations and check-ins (REQ-DB-56).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow customers to reserve one or more rooms online (REQ-PERF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable hotel managers to check room availability, update pricing, and manage reservations (REQ-DB-30).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall process and verify payment transactions before confirming reservations (REQ-PERF-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly interface for managing reservations and pricing.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process room reservations within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store room details, including availability, pricing, and room type.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain reservation records, including customer details and check-in data.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store payment transactions and customer billing history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce unique identification for rooms, reservations, and payments.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with hotel industry booking and payment security regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all room reservations, payments, and customer interactions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate room reservations, pricing management, payment processing, and check-in functionality.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Includes user manuals, API documentation, and hotel management policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Hotel industry standards, booking system regulations, and payment security guidelines.
